bow: year old boy obsessed with wearing dresses hey there mommit first time poster and on mobile so apologize for any wonky formatting issues like the title says my two year old son is obsessed with wearing dresses it began about months ago with him touching my hair and saying that he too wanted long hair and wearing towels and scarves on top of his head to mimic longer hair thought it was cute and certainly did discourage it often helped him create little up do or tie the scarf in ponytail since then he has become increasingly interested in princesses and dresses bought him moana dress which he loved and never ever wanted to take off and ve since bought him normal simple girly dress from target every time we let him wear it his eyes light up and swear he gets this quiet confidence and just swells with pride when he sees himself in it in the mirror he will say look so beautiful or am princess or even am girl this is usually quite adorable but at the same time never thought about how would react or parent child who enjoyed traditionally opposite gendered clothing when he not in his own dresses he is begging to wear one of my shirts long enough to be dress on him and screams for hours if have to take off his dress to wash it we have taken him out to the park and library in his dress and he has blast we ve gotten few people asking how old she is etc and just answer and do really correct them or go on about it he has fairly masculine name and an older brother so sure when refer to them as brothers or call him by name it can be confusing have been able to talk about this much my husband is kind of uncomfortable with it but is banning it he just kind of letting me take the reigns anyone else boy kiddo into dresses or vice versa love my son whether he remains my son or eventually becomes my daughter just want to parent him in these early years the best that can should overhaul his wardrobe to that of girlier fashions save the dresses for special occasions let him wear dresses as long as they are strictly costumes husband idea encourage it when he says he princess or girl am just totally overthinking this because he only and still poops in diaper and barely knows his middle name haha any advice would be helpful with the exception of hateful angry or transphobic advice of course thanks for reading removed also realize didn reply to your actual questions lol follow his lead go shopping and let him pick out what he likes let him wear it when he wants to be his biggest supporter and show him how proud you are of him you seem like an amazing mom already so he lucky to have you not at all trying to sound transphobic or anything like that my nephew went through phase like this he seemed to think that girls were better or prettier or something and would be sad when made to be boy he has two sisters so that could have influenced it they just showed him how cool it is to be boy took him to do some boy things and dad showed him how cool it is to pee outside and stuff they werent trying to change him just wanted him to see he did in fact have value as boy or girl don have any tips do want to say think how you re handling it so far sounds excellent and mom of two young boys hugs mama ♥️♥️ thanks for the response agree with how your nephew fam handled it ie showing the cool parts of being boy too my son definitely sees his older bro and dad enjoying bein dudes and can happily join in he just is even happier to be twirling in tutu and calling himself cinderella awww thanks so much have certainly been leaning into the biggest supporter role lately now that ve seen his choices are showing signs of changing encouraging him to continue dressing the way that makes him happy definitely seems like the right choice hugs to you thanks removed my son is and does girly things sometimes he loves playing with jewelry and going to the store with me to find new pretty neclaces and things we let him grow his hair out for while since he said he wanted it long like mom we ended up cutting it cause it was just in his eyes but we let him choose if he wanted to cut it or put it in pony tail he would also put my shoes on and walk around the house he also sometimes would say things like your son does like looking pretty like girl and stuff do know if have any advise but think it somewhat normal for kids to want to just experiment or look pretty or dress like mom since you re with him all the time sounds like you re doing good job though let my son do what he wants with his clothes and hair so that when he older he knows wo judge him if he is different than other kids my son loves dresses whenever we go to any kind of kids cafe with dress up stations he always brings us princess dresses to wear totally cool with it if he wants to wear dresses go ahead this weekend is his birthday and we ve bought him princess dress and nail varnish which he absolutely loves as well as book on cars some duplo and richard scarry book honestly my opinion is to expose explain and let them direct based on their interests and desires my year old has told me that he wants to be women after some probing on my end he told me he wants to be women because he wants to be just like mommy at this age don think they are able to understand gender identity he might love dresses because he sees you in them and wants to be just like you just though could now phase could be what truly makes him happy but think it too soon to tell was thinking he just wants to be bit more like mom or character on tv or whatever my kid tells me she is going to be kitty cat when she grows up and goes to school wearing bunny ears everyday like awesome whatever so long as her teeth are brushed and she dressed in weather appropriate clothing okay was like this wanted short hair like boy and wanted to be called max and only wanted boy clothes grew out of it and my mum supported it with certain limits she would try her hardest for neutral clothing and gave me pixie winona ryder haircut that loved think the influence of bigger brother and having mostly only friends at daycare and pre that we re boys was the reason why it was from about years old glad it wasn taken to seriously by anyone nothing wrong with that his younger sister is regularly princess spiderman so all things can be gender neutral our year old likes to have his fingernails painted and my husband and could care less we live in socal so admittedly it not the most taboo thing out there we ve gotten few remarks from his teachers etc but it doesn bother us figured rather him be himself or whatever he chooses to identify as when he older than conform to whatever gender norms society is dictating preschool teacher and one of my 2s just turned 3s wears dresses sometimes on field trip to flower show he wore floral dress and was really excited about it you do have to encourage it but would discourage it their self expression is an important part of their development at this age and it not unlikely that he will grow out of it eventually it not uncommon for children to go through phase like this and it not predictive of whether they ll be trans later think letting him enjoy the dresses but not reading into it too much yet is fine approach to take both my boys looooooved wearing dresses they go to friend house and they loved playing dress up with their girl friends they are and and no longer seem to want to but even if they did let them not going to lie wondered myself if it was okay but it made them so happy didn want to stop them it fine he he likes playing dress up and playing in dresses at home dressing up out in public is another thing understand that he is and doesn have the concept of gender or identity yet don push your child to identify as the opposite sex unless he brings it up mom friend of mine got excited and encouraged her child down this path when years later the child ended up wanting to be the sex they were born with but had very difficult time readjusting kids at school were very confused because they had seen the child as different genders and tormented the kid until they had to switch schools twice the kid is now in the phase where they are angry with the mom with letting them dress up at school the child is angry with themselves and now wares all black and locks themselves in their room moving schools and readjusting has been very hard on the family know the mom regrets it my friend and her husband have fought lot about it and know it hurt thief marriage not saying this is going to happen to you and know that there are families where transitioning is the right choice just want to share my friends experience with you so you know what she is still going through if he wants to dress up like girl have it be at home for play time until they are older to understand who they really are and what they really want so that you don accidentally hurt your child and your relationship with them in the long run know you are trying to be open and excepting of your son and that is amazing but please let him decide when he is older to make big life changing life decision after seeing what my friend has gone through don think it right to let your small toddler decide their own gender remember for years was tom boy and my mom always told me might as well have been boy because never wanted to ware dresses my boy cousin used to play dress up with his sisters and now he grown married man think dressing as the opposite sex and feeling like you want to be something else is normal in children and just apart of finding yourself let him lead his own path and make his own mind about it when he is older and can understand what it means sorry if this isn what you were looking for but have to share my friends story with you this is the age when kids are solidifying gender markers in their heads and forming their own identity think the way you are handling it is great you need to take your cues from your child not suggesting you actively encourage it but give it the same attention as if your child chose more traditionally masculine clothing if that makes sense until kids hit puberty any gendered things are purely cosmetic clothing hair name and can all be changed as the child changes personally would discourage the costume idea because that makes it seem like it only okay for play or as joke and the guy in dress trope is very harmful to trans people it may not seem like much but innocent intended comments like this have way of sticking 95 sure the reason didn consider my gender until after my first son was born is comment my mom made about being the only one to pass on the family name see lot of parallels with the stories hear from trans people that realized early in life have been told and from observation most kids that play dress up in clothing associated with different gender they don say they are that gender one kid know even got upset when asked him what pronouns to use when they are wearing dress and wig so the girl statement really jumps out at me sources work with kids am trans woman if you want my inbox is always open and would be more than happy to discuss this further if you desire that reminded me 33f of when was years old and got really short haircut stranger asked if was boy or girl boy told him and what your name batman my kiddo is under year so we haven hit this type of male cartoon character while playing when he was no more than few years old his dad flipped out and yelled at him they think it cute story was horrified think you re doing fine let him wear what he happy with this is great opportunity to let him pick things out in the store or online have friend whose son has long hair wears dresses and is constantly mistaken for girl but is still firm in his he gender identity one year in our daycare halloween parade we had three year old boys who chosen to be elsa no one batted an eye this may be phase or it may be longer term thing either way your son will
